in our case time is limited if we look at it objectively we can most likely make a realistic full-length film that will last around an hour to 90 minutes working backwards from that we can assume that it will take around a week to shoot the film looking at the prices for the camera it'll be around 8 000 yen per day and we'll have that total to 56 000 yen the tripod will cost us 8 000 yen 56 000 yen for a week the battery and memory card and stuff like that will cost around 12 000 yen a day totalling around 84 000 yen the microphone will cost us 10 000 yen per day so that's 70 000 yen for a week we'll also need a van to carry all this equipment that costs 40 000 yen per day totalling to 280 000 yen for the week that leaves us with around 780 000 yen for other things and people the screenplay hasn't been confirmed yet but we should set aside 150 000 yen for the budget even if we try to do most of the shooting without a permit to save money it'd probably still cost upward of 50 000 yen to rent some locations as for the script i found a guy from the university's film club who's made his own film before he said that he will take 100 000 yen for the commission that means we can put aside 420 000 yen for the actors and actresses and i've also taken into account other staff that we would need this would cost around 170 000 yen
we'll borrow the editing equipment which will cost approximately 100 000 yen another 50 000 yen for travelling and emergencies altogether it should be doable with around 1 82 million yen
